meanings.sent1: The bird's beak had a small uncus at the end.
meanings.sent2: She used the uncus on the wall to hang her keys.
meanings.sent3: The uncus on the coat hook looked like a tiny question mark.
meanings.sent4: His fishing line got caught on an uncus of the rock, like a grappling hook.
meanings.sent5: The uncus of the plant was sharp and caught on his sleeve.

meanings.definition: A part of the hippocampus in the brain
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to the uncus on the brain scan.
meanings.sent2: The uncus is responsible for memory formation in the brain.
meanings.sent3: The uncus in the brain is like a librarian organizing memories.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts clung to the uncus of the hippocampus, trying to remember.
meanings.sent5: The uncus of the brain is crucial for recalling past events.

meanings.definition: A type of anatomical structure in certain organisms
meanings.sent1: The uncus of the insect helped it grip onto the leaf.
meanings.sent2: The uncus of the moth is used for sensing pheromones.
meanings.sent3: The uncus of the caterpillar wiggled as it moved along the branch.
meanings.sent4: The uncus of the butterfly fluttered delicately in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The uncus of the bee was covered in pollen after visiting flowers.
